Time: Arrival at 10am for registration and refreshments, for a 10.30am start and 3pm finish (using...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/Jisc-Collections-Members-Forum-for-Higher-Education-Event---4th-June-2014-London/</guid>       <pubDate>Thu, 01 May 2014 15:50:11 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>Jisc Collections Higher Education 2014 Webinar Programme (April to June)</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/Jisc-Collections-Higher-Education-2014-Webinar-Programme11/</link>       <description>Jisc Collections is pleased to announce that we will be running a series of webinars for Higher Education Institutions over the coming months, to provide updates to our members and to discuss key topics, with reference to the work we are doing on our members behalf in 2014. Please see below a full overview of the 2014 HE Webinar Programme. Date Time Topic Thursday 10th April 2014 15.00 A summar...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/Jisc-Collections-Higher-Education-2014-Webinar-Programme11/</guid>       <pubDate>Wed, 11 Jun 2014 15:06:33 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>Jisc Collections Higher Education 2014 Webinar Programme (April to June)</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/Jisc-Collections-Higher-Education-2014-Webinar-Programme1/</link>       <description>Jisc Collections is pleased to announce that we will be running a series of webinars for Higher Education Institutions over the coming months, to provide updates to our members and to discuss key topics, with reference to the work we are doing on our members behalf in 2014. Please see below a full overview of the 2014 HE Webinar Programme. Date Time Topic Thursday 10th April 2014 15.00 A summar...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/Jisc-Collections-Higher-Education-2014-Webinar-Programme1/</guid>       <pubDate>Thu, 01 May 2014 15:35:28 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>KU Feb 2014 webinar2</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/KU-Feb-2014-webinar/</link>       <description>When? The webinar is scheduled for: Wednesday 5th of February at 3:00 pm\ufffd\ufffdGMT Thursday 6th of February at 4:00 pm GMT\ufffd\ufffd(Repeat) What will be covered? The webinar will cover: What Knowledge Unlatched is What KU is trying to achieve How the KU model works How to sign up for the KU Pilot Collection The webinar is expected to last for around 40 minutes and participants will have the opportunity to as...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/KU-Feb-2014-webinar/</guid>       <pubDate>Mon, 20 Jan 2014 12:11:40 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>KU Jan 2014 webinar</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/KU-Jan-2014-webinar/</link>       <description>When? The webinar is scheduled for: Tuesday 21 January at 2pm GMT Thursday 6 February at 2pm GMT (Repeat) What will be covered? The webinar will cover: What Knowledge Unlatched is What KU is trying to achieve How the KU model works How to sign up for the KU Pilot Collection The webinar is expected to last for around 40 minutes and participants will have the opportunity to ask questions. </description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/KU-Jan-2014-webinar/</guid>       <pubDate>Mon, 20 Jan 2014 12:06:18 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>Creating Resources for MOOCs</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/Creating-Resources-for-MOOCs/</link>       <description>This webinar looks at the types of video resources used in MOOCs and various methods of acquiring or creating these resources. Jisc Digital Media will look at good practice in the use of video resources, finding and creating resources and have a look at some of the most popular platforms for MOOC creation and their approaches to video. In addition, they hope to have case studies from people who...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/Creating-Resources-for-MOOCs/</guid>       <pubDate>Tue, 17 Sep 2013 09:39:53 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>OA Monographs Conference</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/oabooksconf/</link>       <description>and\ufffd\ufffd present Open Access Monographs in the Humanities and Social Sciences Conference (#OAbooks) On the 1 and 2 July 2013, JISC Collections , in partnership with OAPEN Foundation , held the Open Access Monographs in the Humanities and Social Sciences conference (#OAbooks) . Hosted at the British Library and sponsored by Jisc, AHRC, ESRC, FWF and NWO, the conference was attended by over 250...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/oabooksconf/</guid>       <pubDate>Thu, 24 Jan 2013 13:42:45 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>Knowledge Base+ Release 2 Overview Event</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/Knowledge-Base-Release-2-Overview-Event/</link>       <description>Back in September we launched Phase 1 of Knowledge Base+ and we are now about to launch Phase 2 of KB+. To mark this we will be holding an event in London where you can come to find out about the new functionality that has been added since last September. The new Release includes the following: support for the renewals cycle an updated permissions model the ability to add Organisation and Role...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/Knowledge-Base-Release-2-Overview-Event/</guid>       <pubDate>Tue, 22 Jan 2013 21:44:06 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>UKSG E-Resources for FE 2012</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/UKSG-/</link>       <description>This seminar will address the issues and practicalities of providing and managing effective high quality e-resource collections within Further Education libraries. During the day there will be opportunities to hear best practice case studies in managing e-resources and in evaluating their use, together with advice and strategies from current practitioners in colleges, and an opportunity to lear...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/UKSG-/</guid>       <pubDate>Thu, 08 Nov 2012 16:58:09 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>UKSG One Day Conference 15 Nov</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/UKSG-One-Day-Conference-15-Nov/</link>       <description>Rethinking collections: approaches, business models, experiences Users now cast their 'discovery net' beyond the conventional notions of a library collection, and the wider digital transition is causing all parties to reassess how they acquire and provide content. How are libraries, publishers and intermediaries meeting the challenge? How will these changes contribute to an improved...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/UKSG-One-Day-Conference-15-Nov/</guid>       <pubDate>Fri, 07 Sep 2012 12:11:02 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>JISC Collections 2012 Conference and AGM</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/2012conference/</link>       <description>Last year it was trains, this year it\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Brunel\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds ss Great Britain , one of the most important historic ships in the world. Come and join JISC Collections on Tuesday 20th November at Brunel\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds ss Great Britain in Bristol for our 2012 Conference and AGM. Our theme this year is Paddles, Propellers, Sails and Steam. Brunel originally designed the ss Great Britain with huge paddle wheels but quickly...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/2012conference/</guid>       <pubDate>Mon, 23 Jul 2012 16:08:21 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>RAPTOR Scotland workshop September</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/RAPTOR-Scotland-workshop-September/</link>       <description>Raptor is a free to use, open source software suite generally designed to enable accounting within event-based systems, and specifically aimed at accounting within systems that handle authentication\ufffd\ufffd such as the Shibboleth IdP, OpenAthens LA, and EZproxy. See http://iam.cf.ac.uk/RAPTOR \ufffd\ufffd for further information.\ufffd\ufffd The Raptor workshops are aimed at technical and non-technical users alike, at both...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/RAPTOR-Scotland-workshop-September/</guid>       <pubDate>Fri, 29 Jun 2012 11:22:54 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>JC 2012 HE Summer Roadshows</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/JC-2012-HE-Summer-Roadshows/</link>       <description>The HE Roadshow events are planned for Edinburgh, Leeds, Cardiff, Leicester, Suffolk and London. Each workshop will start at 10:30 and will finish by 15:15. Please register your interest in participating in one of the HE Roadshows by completing the registration form \ufffd\ufffd Nearer the date we shall provide full details of venue location, travel and parking and any other details you may need to know....</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/JC-2012-HE-Summer-Roadshows/</guid>       <pubDate>Wed, 16 May 2012 12:12:37 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>McShib Forum</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/McShib-/</link>       <description>In the spirit of the community event that is McShib, the agenda is yet to be finalised and we are asking for your ideas on what should be on the agenda - and of course volunteers to present. Please let us know what you'd like to hear about and tell us about problems you are currently grappling with. Do you want to improve your use of attributes but don't know how? Are you thinking about using...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/McShib-/</guid>       <pubDate>Wed, 08 Feb 2012 13:37:21 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>2011 Conference and AGM booking closed</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/2011-Conference-and-AGM-booking-closed/</link>       <description>Our forthcoming Annual Conference and AGM is proving to be very popular as we are now at full capacity. Unfortunately this means that registration for this event is now closed. However if you have not had a chance a book your place and are intersted in attending we will add you to the waiting list. For those of you that have booked your place, we look forward to meeting you\ufffd\ufffdon Thursday 24...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/2011-Conference-and-AGM-booking-closed/</guid>       <pubDate>Mon, 31 Oct 2011 17:49:38 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>UKSG E-Resources for FE</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/UKSG-E-Resources-for-FE/</link>       <description>This seminar will address the issues and practicalities of providing and managing effective high quality e-resources collections within Further Education libraries. There will be opportunities to hear best practice case studies in managing e-resources with a particular focus on marketing techniques and strategies from current practitioners in colleges, as well as learning the latest about JISC\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/UKSG-E-Resources-for-FE/</guid>       <pubDate>Thu, 13 Oct 2011 13:01:00 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>JISC Collections 2011 Conference</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/JISC-Collections-2011-Conference/</link>       <description>The JISC Collections 2011 Conference and AGM will be held on Thursday 24 November 2011 at the National Railway Museum in York.\ufffd\ufffd In the morning session, we will hear about some of the highlights of the past year and challenges for the year to come from Lorraine Estelle, CEO of JISC Collections and representatives of the HE and FE sector. In the afternoon session we will be looking at the lifecyc...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/JISC-Collections-2011-Conference/</guid>       <pubDate>Fri, 26 Aug 2011 14:47:01 GMT</pubDate>     </item>     <item>       <title>UKSG Nov 2011 Conference</title>       <link>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/UKSG-Nov-2011-Conference/</link>       <description>A Problem Shared? Understanding shared services and the drive for efficiency in scholarly communications The one-day UKSG conference is this year focussing on "Shared Services", a concept that is increasingly talked about in the scholarly communications sector, where prominent examples include centralised or consortial procurement (e.g. NESLi2) and collaborative cataloguing (e.g. OCLC). Shared...</description>       <guid>https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/UKSG-Nov-2011-Conference/</guid>       <pubDate>Thu, 14 Jul 2011 11:39:42 GMT</pubDate>     </item>   </channel> </rss>
